trans-unit.source: Create a Logic App with an API app
trans-unit.target: Create a Logic App with an API app

trans-unit.source: Use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy a Logic App and an API app.
trans-unit.target: Use an Azure Resource Manager template to deploy a Logic App and an API app.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you will learn how to create an Azure Resource Manager template to create a logic app with an App Service API app.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you will learn how to create an Azure Resource Manager template to create a logic app with an App Service API app.

trans-unit.source: You can use the logic app to design workflows that articulate intent through a trigger and a series of steps, each invoking the API app while securely taking care of authentication and best practices like durable execution.
trans-unit.target: You can use the logic app to design workflows that articulate intent through a trigger and a series of steps, each invoking the API app while securely taking care of authentication and best practices like durable execution.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to define which resources are deployed and how to define parameters that are specified when the deployment is executed.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to define which resources are deployed and how to define parameters that are specified when the deployment is executed.

trans-unit.source: You can use this template for your own deployments, or customize it to meet your requirements.
trans-unit.target: You can use this template for your own deployments, or customize it to meet your requirements.

trans-unit.source: For more details on the logic app properties, see <linkText>Logic App Workflow Management API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details on the logic app properties, see <linkText>Logic App Workflow Management API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For examples of the definition itself, see <linkText>Author Logic App definitions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of the definition itself, see <linkText>Author Logic App definitions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information about creating templates, see <linkText>Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about creating templates, see <linkText>Authoring Azure Resource Manager Templates</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For the complete template, see <linkText>Logic App with API app template</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the complete template, see <linkText>Logic App with API app template</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: With this template, you will provision:
trans-unit.target: With this template, you will provision:

trans-unit.source: Logic App
trans-unit.target: Logic App

trans-unit.source: API app
trans-unit.target: API app

trans-unit.source: To run the deployment automatically, click the following button:
trans-unit.target: To run the deployment automatically, click the following button:

trans-unit.source: [<linkText>Deploy to Azure</linkText>](https://portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.Template/uri/https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FAzure%2Fazure-quickstart-templates%2Fmaster%2F201-logic-app-api-app-create%2Fazuredeploy.json)
trans-unit.target: [<linkText>Deploy to Azure</linkText>](https://portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.Template/uri/https%3A%2F%2Fraw.githubusercontent.com%2FAzure%2Fazure-quickstart-templates%2Fmaster%2F201-logic-app-api-app-create%2Fazuredeploy.json)

trans-unit.source: The name of the API app.
trans-unit.target: The name of the API app.

trans-unit.source: The name of the gateway.
trans-unit.target: The name of the gateway.

trans-unit.source: The secret for the API app.
trans-unit.target: The secret for the API app.

trans-unit.source: Creates an app service plan.
trans-unit.target: Creates an app service plan.

trans-unit.source: It uses the same location as the resource group to which it is being deployed.
trans-unit.target: It uses the same location as the resource group to which it is being deployed.

trans-unit.source: Creates the web app to host the gateway.
trans-unit.target: Creates the web app to host the gateway.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the gateway includes a child resource for an authentication token.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the gateway includes a child resource for an authentication token.

trans-unit.source: This token is used by the Logic app to call into the gateway.
trans-unit.target: This token is used by the Logic app to call into the gateway.

trans-unit.source: Creates the logic app.
trans-unit.target: Creates the logic app.

trans-unit.source: A logic app requires a name, location, SKU (which points to that App service plan), definition, and, optionally, parameters.
trans-unit.target: A logic app requires a name, location, SKU (which points to that App service plan), definition, and, optionally, parameters.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the logic app uses the token to call the gateway.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the logic app uses the token to call the gateway.
